Crainquebille

Also known as Bill in the USA; Old Bill of Paris in the United Kingdom : [Coster Bill of Paris] : {Cranque Bill}

(1923) France

B&W : [?] Five or Six? reels / 1600 metres

Directed by Jacques Feyder

Cast: Maurice de FÃ©raudy [JÃ©rÃ´me Crainquebille], Jean Forest [la souris (the mouse)], Marguerite CarrÃ© [Madame Laure], Jeanne Cheirel [Madame Bayard], Armand NumÃ¨s [le prÃ©sident, the preciding judge], FÃ©lix Oudart [Constable 64], RenÃ© Worms [M. Lemerle, the defense attorney], Charles Mosnier [Docteur Mathieu], FranÃ§oise Rosay [a shoe store customer]

Films Legrand production. / Scenario by Jacques Feyder, from the short story Lâaffaire Crainquebille by Anatole France. Art direction by Manuel Orazi. Cinematography by LÃ©once-Henri Burel and Maurice Forster. / Standard 35mm spherical 1.33:1 format. / The film was released in the USA by Red Seal Pictures Corporation in 1923. The film was restored by Lobster Films, Paris, in collaboration with Lenny Borger in 2005.

Drama: Social satire.

Survival status: Prints exist in the Lobster Films film collection [35mm restoration negative, 35mm restoration positives]; and in private film collections [16mm reduction positives].

Current rights holder: (unknown) [France]; Public domain [USA].

Keywords: Authors: Anatole France - Dreams - Law: Judges

Listing updated: 28 June 2024.

References: Film viewing : BardÃ¨che-History pp. 162-163, 233; Limbacher-Feature p. 52 : Website-IMDb : with additional information provided by Lenny Borger.
